sentences.en: Error is often the precursor of what is correct, but conceit is the prelude to a fall.
sentences.cn: 错误往往是正确的先导, 骄傲是跌跤的前奏.

sentences.en: His investigations were a necessary prelude to the subsequent discovery of the cause of particle motions.
sentences.cn: 他的研究是以后发现粒子运动原因的必要先导.

sentences.en: I'm afraid that these troubles are just a prelude , ie to worse ones.
sentences.cn: 我看这些为难事只是个引子(大问题在后面).

sentences.en: In his autobiographical poem'The Prelude ', Wordsworth describes his boyhood in the Lakes.
sentences.cn: 在他的自传体诗《序曲》中,华茲华斯描述了自己在英格兰北部湖区的童年生活.

sentences.en: It all reminded me uncomfortably of prelude to the Bay of Pigs.
sentences.cn: 这一切使我不安地回想起猪湾事件发生前的情景.

sentences.en: Living together as a prelude to marriage is now considered acceptable in many countries.
sentences.cn: 婚前同居如今在许多国家都已被接受。

sentences.en: Love is but a prelude to life.
sentences.cn: 爱情仅仅是生活的序曲.

sentences.en: Michelson and Morley had sounded the prelude to special relativity.
sentences.cn: 迈克耳孙和莫雷已经奏出了狭义相对论的序曲.

sentences.en: The bankruptcy of several small firms was the prelude to general economic collapse.
sentences.cn: 几家小商行倒闭了,随之而来的是经济大萧条.

sentences.en: The curtain rises toward the end of the Prelude.
sentences.cn: 序曲将近结束时帷幕升起来了。

sentences.en: The discussions were a prelude to the treaty.
sentences.cn: 这些讨论是签订该条约的前奏.

sentences.en: The orchestra played a short prelude before the ballet began.
sentences.cn: 管弦乐队在芭蕾舞开始之前演奏了一段很短的前奏曲.

sentences.en: The person, whoever it was, gave a small cough, evidently as a prelude to speaking.
sentences.cn: 那个人, 不知是谁, 轻轻地咳了一声, 显然是表示要说话.

sentences.en: The prelude to the musical composition is very long.
The prelude was as iridescent as a prism in a morning room.
sentences.cn: 这个序曲就象清晨房间里的一块三棱镜一样灿烂辉煌.

sentences.en: The resolution was the prelude to more drastic action.
sentences.cn: 这项决议只是更激烈的行为的前奏.

trans.tran_cn: 序曲，前奏曲，开场戏，序幕，前兆，预兆
trans.tran_en: a short piece of music, especially one played at the beginning of a longer musical piece or before a church ceremony

trans.tran_cn: 成为…的序幕；演奏…作为前奏曲
